etymology.interpretation: The flesh/meat component signals a body part. 卻 provides the sound and helps point to a limb, specifically the foot or leg.
etymology.simplification: The phonetic component 卻 was simplified to 却, so 腳 became 脚; the left-side meat component remains in its abbreviated 月 form.

examples.chinese: 他扭伤了脚(他扭傷了腳)。
他站在山脚等我们(他站在山腳等我們)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàn zài shānjiǎo děng wǒmen.
examples.english: He waited at the foot of the mountain for us.
